info.name: Betobeto-kun
info.description: Betobeto-kun familiar from Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

element.name: Betobeto-kun
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Armor Class 12
Hit Points 3 (1d4 + 1)
Speed 30 ft.
Skills Stealth +4
Condition Immunities frightened
Senses darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10
Languages understands Common but can’t speak

Audiophile. Whenever the betobeto-kun hears a creature that it hasn’t encountered before, it must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the betobeto-kun loudly mimics the creature's noises for the next 10 minutes, automatically failing Stealth checks against creatures that can hear it.

Frighten.
The betobeto-kun attempts to scare a creature within 5 feet of it by making a sudden movement and a loud noise. The creature must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or take 4 (1d8) psychic damage. A creature automatically fails the saving throw and is frightened of the betobeto-kun until the end of the betobeto-kun's next turn if it rolls a 1 or lower on the d20.

sheet.description: Betobeto-kun ({{betobeto:size}}) - It gains {{hit dice gained:companion:betobeto}}d{{hit dice size:betobeto}} hit dice. DC: {{betobeto:dc}}. AC: +{{betobeto:ac bonus}}. Frighten: {{frighten:damage}} psychic damage.

element.name: Betobeto-kun Improvement
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Whenever you gain a level beyond 1st in this class, each companion to which you are bonded gains one of the following improvements. Any newly gained companions receive these additional Hit Dice and improvements as if you had them since your 1st level in tamer.

sheet.description: The Betobeto-kun has the following Improvements:

element.name: Jumpscare
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)
If the betobeto-kun is hidden from a creature when it uses its Frighten action on it, the creature has disadvantage on the saving throw.

In addition, when one or more more creatures become frightened by the betobeto-kun, the betobeto-kun gains 2d6 temporary hit points, which last for 1 minute. When the betobeto-kun’s tamer reaches 5th level, these temporary hit points increase to 3d6.

sheet.description: Hidden + Frighten = Disadvantage on save. Grant {{jumpscare}}d6 temp HP.

element.name: Shadow Armour I
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)
While in dim light or darkness and not wearing any armour, the betobeto-kun gains a +2 bonus to AC.

sheet.description: While in dim light or darkness and not wearing armour: +2 AC.

element.name: Shadow Stealth I
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Active (bonus action)
While in dim light or darkness, the betobeto-kun can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

sheet.description: While in dim light or darkness: Hide.

element.name: Growth
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)
The betobeto-kun’s size increases to Small, its Hit Die size increases to a d6 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice).

element.name: Scary I
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Active (action)

The damage of the betobeto-kun’s Frighten action increases to 2d8. In addition, a creature automatically fails the saving throw and is frightened of the betobeto-kun if it rolls a 2 or lower on the d20.

sheet.description: Frighten damage: 2d8. Automatic fail on save if roll is 2 or lower.

element.name: Shadow Stealth II
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Active (bonus action)

While in dim light or darkness, the betobeto-kun can use a bonus action to become invisible, along with anything it’s wearing or carrying. The invisibility lasts until the betobeto-kun uses a bonus action to end it, is in bright light or incapacitated, attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Frighten action. As part of the same bonus action, the betobeto-kun can immediately take the Hide action.

sheet.description: While in dim light/darkness: Become invisible. Can Hide as part of the same bonus action.

element.name: Shadow Armour II
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)
While in dim light or darkness and not wearing any armour, the betobeto-kun gains a +2 bonus to AC. This improvement is in addition to the bonus from Shadow Armour I.

sheet.description: While in dim light or darkness and not wearing armour: +4 AC (total).

element.name: Sow Panic
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Active (action)
The betobeto-kun can cast the fear spell, requiring no verbal or material components. Once it casts this spell, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a long rest.

sheet.description: Cast fear (no verbal or material components).

element.name: Fear-Eater
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Active (action)

As an action, the betobeto-kun can devour the fear of a frightened creature it can see within 30 feet of it. When it does, it gains 3d6 temporary hit points, the frightened condition ends for that creature, and the creature suffers one of the effects described below (tamer’s choice):

ul.li: The creature becomes immune to the frightened condition until the end of the betobeto-kun’s next turn.
The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 5d8 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

sheet.description: Devour fear of frightened creature within 30 ft. Gain 3d6 temporary hit points. Target either becomes immune to frightened until end of next turn. WIS save or 5d8 psychic damage (or half).

element.name: Scary II
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Active (action)

The damage of the betobeto-kun’s Frighten action increases to 3d8. In addition, a creature automatically fails the saving throw and is frightened of the betobeto-kun if it rolls a 3 or lower on the d20.

When the betobeto-kun’s tamer reaches 17th level in this class, the damage of the betobeto-kun’s Frighten action increases to 4d8. In addition, a creature automatically fails the saving throw and is frightened of the betobeto-kun if it rolls a 4 or lower on the d20.

sheet.description: Automatic fail on save if roll is 3 or lower.
Automatic fail on save if roll is 4 or lower.

element.name: Shadow Aura
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Type: Passive (companion), Active (reaction)

The betobeto-kun dims light within 5 feet of it; dim light becomes darkness and bright light becomes dim light. This improvement has no effect on light created by a spell of 6th level or higher, or by a magic item of very rare rarity or greater.

In addition, while in dim light or darkness, the betobeto-kun’s speed increases by 10 feet, and it can use a reaction when it takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage to partially meld into the shadows, halving the damage it takes.

sheet.description: Dims light within 5 ft. While in dim light/darkness: +10 ft. speed, reaction to halve bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

element.name: Speed Training
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Increase one existing speed by 15 feet up to a maximum of 150% of the creature’s base speed, rounded up to the nearest 5-foot increment.
E.g., a base speed of 30 feet can be increased to 45 feet maximum, a base speed of 25 feet can be increased to 40 feet, and a base speed of 20 feet to 30 feet.

sheet.description: Increase one existing speed by 15 feet (Max of 150%)

element.name: War Training
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Your companion gains proficiency with one armour type or two weapons.

p.i: Your companion can’t gain proficiency in medium and heavy armour until it has gained proficiency in the prerequisite lighter armour types. For example, to gain proficiency in heavy armour, you must take this improvement 3 times: light, then medium, then heavy. Work with your GM to figure out if and how a creature can wield shields and weapons.
